seller_description: Product Description: Dole Packaged Foods, LLC is a world leader in growing, sourcing, distributing, and marketing fruit and healthy snacks. Dole sells a full line of packaged shelf stable fruit, frozen fruit, dried fruit, and juices. The company focuses on four pillars of sustainability in all its operations: water management, carbon footprint, soil conservation, and water reduction. Pineapples are a symbol of hospitality, tropical vacations and fun, so it makes sense Dole would take this yummy goodness and put it in a can. Dole Canned 100  Juice* is refreshing, exotic and a delicious alternative to other juices. Dole Juice is 100  juice that is an excellent source of Vitamin C. Gluten free and in BPA free packaging, it tastes great on its own, or in your favorite smoothie, mocktail, cocktail, or marinade. Store unopened juice in a cool, dry place. If you prefer a chilled juice, keep an unopened can in your refrigerator. Shake well before serving. After opening, store in a glass or plastic container in the refrigerator. *With other ingredients. Product details. Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No. Product Dimensions : 15 x 10 x 6 inches; 13.1 Pounds. Item model number : 10038900773700. UPC : 038900773700. Manufacturer : Dole Foods. ASIN : B002IGA2FW. Country of Origin : Philippines
review: I'm not even sure most of these are safe to drink because the cans are all damaged, but I drank one of the least damaged ones, and the flavor is delicious, and the expiration date is good. I'm not sure if I should recommend this item or not, because I see that so many other customers also received damaged cans. These were not advertised as dented or otherwise damaged, but they should have been because I wouldn't have ordered them.
expected-output: Seller's Image and Description: The seller’s image shows neatly packaged cans of 100% Dole Pineapple Juice in undamaged condition, consistent with what one would expect from a fresh product. The description emphasizes the juice’s quality, BPA-free packaging, Vitamin C content, and other positive attributes, with no mention of any potential damage or defect. Buyer's Image and Review: The buyer’s image reveals multiple cans with visible dents and damage. According to the review, 20 out of 48 cans arrived dented, and the packaging itself was undamaged, implying that the damage likely occurred before shipping, possibly at the manufacturing or packing stage. The buyer mentions being uncertain about the safety of consuming the juice from damaged cans, which wasn’t anticipated based on the seller’s description. Discrepancy: The primary discrepancy lies in the condition of the product. The seller's images and description suggest an undamaged, high-quality item, while the buyer received damaged cans, leading to safety concerns and disappointment. This aligns with the buyer’s assertion that the product condition should have been disclosed, especially if the dents occurred prior to shipping. Conclusion: The buyer is dissatisfied due to the poor condition of the cans, which may pose safety issues. The fault likely lies with the seller or the manufacturing/packaging process rather than shipping. Proper disclosure of any potential for damage in packaging or clearer quality control measures could have prevented this negative experience. The fault in this case lies with the seller, specifically in their manufacturing or quality control processes. The buyer received numerous dented cans, despite undamaged outer packaging, indicating that the damage likely occurred before shipping. This discrepancy between the expected quality in the seller’s description and the buyer’s actual experience points to an issue at the production or packaging stage. Proper quality control checks or disclosure of potential packaging flaws would have better aligned the product with the seller’s claims, preventing the buyer's disappointment and concerns about product safety.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
